text: Herbert Reeve (28 May 1868 – 24 February 1956) was a Church of England clergyman and missionary with benefices in New Zealand. He was Archdeacon of Waitara before returning to England. ==Life== Holt Grammar School in the 19th century St John College, Cambridge Inglewood, in the shadow of Mount Taranaki A son of Dr Edmund Reeve, surgeon, of Reepham, Norfolk, by his marriage to Kate Sewell, Reeve was born at Swaffham, Norfolk, in 1868Cyclopedia of New Zealand, vol. 6 (1908), p. 149 and educated at Holt Grammar School and St John's College, Cambridge, where he was admitted in July 1893 and matriculated in the Michaelmas term of the same year. He graduated BA in 1896 and was promoted to MA in 1901.John Venn, Alumni Cantabrigienses, Part II. 1752–1900, vol. v (1953), p. 268 While at Cambridge, he played rugby union for his college.The Cambridge Review, Volume 15 (1894), p. 25 Reeve had two brothers, Charles Ernest and Arthur, the latter also a clergyman of the Church of England.Croydon Guardian and Surrey County Gazette dated 7 June 1902, p. 7 In 1896 Reeve was ordained a deacon and in 1897 a priest. In 1896 he became Curate at St Matthew's, Newington, Surrey, transferring as Curate to Croydon in 1899. In 1903 he resigned his junior post there to migrate to New Zealand and take up the role of Vicar of Inglewood, where he remained until 1907. For a year he was a missionary priest of the diocese of Auckland, serving the district of East Taranaki,Clergy associated with St John the Evangelist at peoplesnetworknz.info, accessed 27 March 2019 then from 1908 to 1911 was Vicar of the Holy Sepulchre parish, Auckland, and from 1911 to 1924 Vicar of Wanganui. He was also Archdeacon of Waitara from 1915 to 1924. He then returned home to Norfolk, where he was Rector of Brancaster from 1924 to 1945 and Rural Dean of Heacham from 1933 to 1945. While in New Zealand, Reeve married Nora Trischler Merton, the elder daughter of George Henry Merton, head master of the Cathedral School of Christchurch.Thomas Merton and Christ’s College at liturgy.co.nz, accessed 27 March 2019"Golden Wedding. Mr and Mrs G. H. Merton" in The Press dated 1 May 1931, p. 2 at paperspast.natlib.govt.nz, accessed 27 March 2019 Reeve died in February 1956, when he was living at 60 Queen's Gate, Kensington."Reeve, Herbert, aged 87" in Register of Deaths for Kensington Registration District, vol. 5c (1956), p. 1,477 He left a widow, Nora Trischler Reeve, and an estate valued at £2,209."REEVE the reverend Herbert" in Probate Index for 1956 at probatesearch.service.gov.uk, accessed 26 March 2019 Mrs Reeve died in 1960."REEVE, Nora T, aged 76" in Register of Deaths for Ealing Registration District, vol. 5e (1960), p. 37 ==Notes== Category:1868 births Category:1956 deaths Category:Alumni of St John's College, Cambridge Category:20th-century English Anglican priests Category:English Anglican missionaries Category:People educated at Gresham's School Category:Anglican archdeacons in New Zealand
title: Herbert Reeve
